natural problem:
Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\]
natural solution: We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
&= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = j then 0 else if j = (i + 1) mod 3 then (if i = 0 then b - a else if i = 1 then c - b else a - c) else (if i = 0 then c - a else if i = 1 then a - b else b - c)))) = 0"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = j then 0 else if j = (i + 1) mod 3 then (if i = 0 then b - a else if i = 1 then c - b else a - c) else (if i = 0 then c - a else if i = 1 then a - b else b - c)))) = 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem:
Determine whether the determinant of the following 3x3 matrix is equal to zero:

The elements of the matrix are defined as follows:

- If $i=j$, then the element is $0$.
- If $j=(i+1) \mod 3$, then the element is:
  - $b-a$, if $i=0$,
  - $c-b$, if $i=1$,
  - $a-c$, if $i=2$.
- Otherwise, the element is:
  - $c-a$, if $i=0$,
  - $a-b$, if $i=1$,
  - $b-c$, if $i=2$.

Here, $a$, $b$, and $c$ are real numbers, and $i$ and $j$ are the row and column indices, respectively.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a - b = b - a"
and h1 : "a - c = c - a"
and h2 : "b - c = c - b"
shows  "0 = det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>j. if i = j then 0 else if j = (i + 1) mod 3 then b - a else c - a)))"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a - b = b - a"
and h1 : "a - c = c - a"
and h2 : "b - c = c - b"
shows  "0 = det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>j. if i = j then 0 else if j = (i + 1) mod 3 then b - a else c - a)))"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Given that $a - b = b - a$, $a - c = c - a$, and $b - c = c - b$, prove that the determinant of a 3x3 matrix, where the diagonal elements are zero, the elements just above the main diagonal are $b - a$, and the elements just below the main diagonal are $c - a$, is equal to zero.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (vector [vector [0, b - a, c - a], vector [a - b, 0, c - b], vector [a - c, b - c, 0]]) = 0"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (vector [vector [0, b - a, c - a], vector [a - b, 0, c - b], vector [a - c, b - c, 0]]) = 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem:
Determine whether the determinant of the matrix 
\[
\begin{bmatrix}
0 & b - a & c - a \\
a - b & 0 & c - b \\
a - c & b - c & 0 
\end{bmatrix}
\]
is zero.

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a \<noteq> b"
and h1 : "a \<noteq> c"
and h2 : "b \<noteq> c"
shows  "det(matrix([[0, b - a, c - a], [a - b, 0, c - b], [a - c, b - c, 0]])) = 0"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a \<noteq> b"
and h1 : "a \<noteq> c"
and h2 : "b \<noteq> c"
shows  "det(matrix([[0, b - a, c - a], [a - b, 0, c - b], [a - c, b - c, 0]])) = 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem:
Given three distinct real numbers $a$, $b$, and $c$, show that the determinant of the matrix
$
\begin{bmatrix}
0 & b - a & c - a\\
a - b & 0 & c - b\\
a - c & b - c & 0
\end{bmatrix}
$
is zero.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. case (i, j) of 
  (0, 1) \<Rightarrow> b - a | 
  (0, 2) \<Rightarrow> c - a | 
  (1, 0) \<Rightarrow> a - b | 
  (1, 2) \<Rightarrow> c - b | 
  (2, 0) \<Rightarrow> a - c | 
  (2, 1) \<Rightarrow> b - c |
  _ \<Rightarrow> 0))) = 0"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. case (i, j) of 
  (0, 1) \<Rightarrow> b - a | 
  (0, 2) \<Rightarrow> c - a | 
  (1, 0) \<Rightarrow> a - b | 
  (1, 2) \<Rightarrow> c - b | 
  (2, 0) \<Rightarrow> a - c | 
  (2, 1) \<Rightarrow> b - c |
  _ \<Rightarrow> 0))) = 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem:
Determine whether the determinant of the 3x3 matrix, where the elements are defined as follows:

- The element at the first row and second column is $b - a$,
- The element at the first row and third column is $c - a$,
- The element at the second row and first column is $a - b$,
- The element at the second row and third column is $c - b$,
- The element at the third row and first column is $a - c$,
- The element at the third row and second column is $b - c$,
- All other elements are $0$,

is equal to zero.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.mat 3 3 (\<lambda>(i, j). if i = j then 0 else if j = 1 then b - a else if j = 2 then c - a else if i = 1 then a - b else if i = 2 then a - c else b - c)) = 0"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.mat 3 3 (\<lambda>(i, j). if i = j then 0 else if j = 1 then b - a else if j = 2 then c - a else if i = 1 then a - b else if i = 2 then a - c else b - c)) = 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem:
Determine whether the determinant of the following 3x3 matrix is equal to zero:

- The diagonal entries are all zero.
- The first column (excluding the diagonal) is filled with $b - a$.
- The second column (excluding the diagonal) is filled with $c - a$.
- The first row (excluding the diagonal) is filled with $a - b$.
- The second row (excluding the diagonal) is filled with $a - c$.
- The remaining cell is filled with $b - c$.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>j. if j = 0 then (if i = 0 then 0 else if i = 1 then a - b else a - c) 
else if j = 1 then (if i = 0 then b - a else if i = 1 then 0 else b - c) else (if i = 0 then c - a else if i = 1 then c - b else 0)))) = 0"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>j. if j = 0 then (if i = 0 then 0 else if i = 1 then a - b else a - c) 
else if j = 1 then (if i = 0 then b - a else if i = 1 then 0 else b - c) else (if i = 0 then c - a else if i = 1 then c - b else 0)))) = 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem:
Find the determinant of the 3x3 matrix where the elements in the matrix are determined as follows:
- If both indices (i, j) are 0, the element is 0. 
- For the first column (j = 0), if the row index (i) is 1, the element is a - b, and if i is 2, the element is a - c.
- For the second column (j = 1), if i is 0, the element is b - a, and if i is 2, the element is b - c.
- For the third column (j = 2), if i is 0, the element is c - a, and if i is 1, the element is c - b.
- All other elements are 0. 

The final answer is 0.

fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (matrix [[0, b - a, c - a], [a - b, 0, c - b], [a - c, b - c, 0]]) = 0"

a_7.informal problem: Determine whether the determinant of the matrix [[0, b - a, c - a], [a - b, 0, c - b], [a - c, b - c, 0]] equals zero.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>j. if i = j then 0 else if j = (i+1) mod 3 then [b - a, c - b, a - c] ! i else [c - a, a - b, b - c] ! i))) = 0"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda>j. if i = j then 0 else if j = (i+1) mod 3 then [b - a, c - b, a - c] ! i else [c - a, a - b, b - c] ! i))) = 0"

a_8.informal problem: Determine whether the determinant of a 3x3 matrix is zero. The matrix entries are defined as follows: the diagonal entries are all zero, the entries of the row immediately below the diagonal (with wraparound) are $b - a$, $c - b$, and $a - c$, and the rest of the entries are $c - a$, $a - b$, and $b - c$.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "M = matrix (\<lambda>(i, j). if i = 1 ∧ j = 2 then b - a else 
                                  if i = 1 ∧ j = 3 then c - a else 
                                  if i = 2 ∧ j = 1 then a - b else 
                                  if i = 2 ∧ j = 3 then c - b else 
                                  if i = 3 ∧ j = 1 then a - c else 
                                  if i = 3 ∧ j = 2 then b - c else 0)"
shows  "det M = 0"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is 0
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} &= -(b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -(b - a)(-(c - b)(a - c)) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) \\ &= \boxed{0}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "M = matrix (\<lambda>(i, j). if i = 1 ∧ j = 2 then b - a else 
                                  if i = 1 ∧ j = 3 then c - a else 
                                  if i = 2 ∧ j = 1 then a - b else 
                                  if i = 2 ∧ j = 3 then c - b else 
                                  if i = 3 ∧ j = 1 then a - c else 
                                  if i = 3 ∧ j = 2 then b - c else 0)"
shows  "det M = 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem:
Given three real numbers $a$, $b$, and $c$, find the determinant of the $3 \times 3$ matrix $M$, where the elements of $M$ are defined as follows:

- The element at the first row and second column is $b - a$,
- The element at the first row and third column is $c - a$,
- The element at the second row and first column is $a - b$,
- The element at the second row and third column is $c - b$,
- The element at the third row and first column is $a - c$,
- The element at the third row and second column is $b - c$,
- All other elements are $0$.

The determinant of this matrix is $0$.
